Sentencas: The Ni-GDC and Ni-SDC cermets with tailored microstructures are potential candidates for anode materials in intermediate temperature SOFCs.
Titulo: Microstructure tailoring of combustion-derived Ni-GDC and Ni-SDC composites as anode materials for intermediate temperature solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: In this work, a modified citrate-nitrate combustion synthesis was employed for the preparation of cermets.
Titulo: Microstructure tailoring of combustion-derived Ni-GDC and Ni-SDC composites as anode materials for intermediate temperature solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: It was demonstrated that the preparation technique ensured randomly distributed phases of NiO and GDC or SDC on a nanometre scale.
Titulo: Microstructure tailoring of combustion-derived Ni-GDC and Ni-SDC composites as anode materials for intermediate temperature solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: Microstructure analysis revealed that during sintering under various conditions (from 1150 to 1400 A degrees C), the NiO phase grew faster than the GDC or SDC phases; however, phases remained well within the sub-micrometre range.
Titulo: Microstructure tailoring of combustion-derived Ni-GDC and Ni-SDC composites as anode materials for intermediate temperature solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: In order to describe the overall relative electrical conductivity of the cermets, the sine-wave approximation of conductivity change for porous materials was used.
Titulo: Microstructure tailoring of combustion-derived Ni-GDC and Ni-SDC composites as anode materials for intermediate temperature solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: Higher relative densities of the cermets resulted in improved electrical conductivity.
Titulo: Microstructure tailoring of combustion-derived Ni-GDC and Ni-SDC composites as anode materials for intermediate temperature solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: The most appropriate sintering temperature, which ensured relatively small grains and at the same time sufficiently high electrical conductivity, for both materials was determined to be 1200 A degrees C.
Titulo: Microstructure tailoring of combustion-derived Ni-GDC and Ni-SDC composites as anode materials for intermediate temperature solid oxide fuel cells
